name: time-series-chart-utilities
label: Time Series Chart Utilities
description: When using the Time Series Chart Solution Pack, this connector is used by the included playbooks to facilitate the creation of data-over-time or time series charts. The included functions include building a list of datetime-buckets, as well as various utilities to process the output of dataset queries for use by the Time Series Widget.

operations.title: Assemble Query Time Windows
operations.description: Builds a list of time windows, each with a start and end timestamp, from the beginning of a specified duration to the present based on the configuration of an instance of the Time Series Chart Widget. For example, for a chart with relative date "Last 24  Hours" and Time Period "Hourly", this functiton will output a list of 24 start-time and end-time pairs, corresponding to  each hour in that time span.

parameters.title: Relative Date
parameters.name: relativeDate
parameters.description: The full span of time which the corresponding Time Series Chart will reflect, expressed as a JSON in the format {"differenceType": "days", "differenceValue": "-7"}
parameters.tooltip: This is generally going to come directly from the Time Series Chart record for a specific chart

parameters.title: Time Period
parameters.name: time_period
parameters.tooltip: This is generally going to come directly from the Time Series Chart record for a specific chart
parameters.description: The length of time used for each time window. The Relative Date span will be divided into chunks of length corresponding to this parameter.

parameters.title: Date Format String
parameters.name: dateFormatString
parameters.description: The format used within your chart data JSON to express date values

parameters.title: Existing Times
parameters.name: existing_times
parameters.tooltip: The existing time windows will be present as the first entry in the chart's list of data columns
parameters.description: If an existing Time Series Chart is being updated, rather than created for the first time, then the list of time buckets already present in the chart should be passed into this parameter. This is done to keep the time window spacings consistent between updates and prevent data from being missed due to small variances in playbook execution time.

parameters.title: Query Modified
parameters.name: query_modified
parameters.tooltip: This field in the Time Series Chart record will be automatically set when the Time Series Chart Widget is updated
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to True, existing data from previous time windows will be discarded and the entire chart will be re-queried. Otherwise only time windows since the last time this Chart was updated will be queried

operations.title: Flatten Data Sets and Groups
operations.description: Takes Data Set configuration information from a Time Series Chart Record and outputs the base query for each Data Set as well as the plot type and Data Set grouping information which will be used when rendering the final chart

parameters.title: Data Sets
parameters.name: dataSets
parameters.description: This is the JSON-formatted data from the TimeSeries Chart widget configuration. Each Data Set will have its own query and list of filters, potentially with the results grouped based on a picklist field.
parameters.tooltip: This will come directly from the Chart Configuration field in the Time Series Chart record.

operations.title: Format Data Set Output with Field-Grouped
operations.description: When a Data Set is configured to be grouped based on a picklist field, this operation is used to format the Data Set's query results so that they are able to be rendered into a Time Series Chart

parameters.title: Query Results
parameters.name: queryOutput
parameters.description: The output of a Query step, which runs a Data Set's query once for each time bucket which must be queried
parameters.tooltip: This should be a List of Lists, with one List per time bucket to be queried

parameters.title: Time Buckets Queried
parameters.name: timeBucketsQueried
parameters.description: A List of Dictionaries respresenting the start and end timestamps of each time bucket queried

parameters.title: Data Set Configuration
parameters.name: dataSetConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration options selected for this Data Set when configuring the Time Series Chart Widget
parameters.tooltip: This will be a JSON object containing the Data Set's title, plot type, query information, and grouping information

operations.title: Combine Query Results into Data Columns
operations.description: Combines Data Set query results, existing data from a chart being updated (where applicable), and the results of the "Assemble Query Time Windows" operation into a List structure which can be rendered by the Time Series Chart Widget

parameters.title: Playbook Mode
parameters.name: playbookMode
parameters.description: This will dictate whether the output includes previous results, or whether they will be overwritten
parameters.tooltip: Either "new_chart" or "update_buckets", based on the output of "Assemble Query Time Windows"

parameters.title: First Index to Keep
parameters.name: firstIndexToKeep
parameters.description: When updating an existing Time Series Chart, any data prior to this index will be discarded, as it represents time windows which no longer fit within the duration of time which the updated chart will show.
parameters.tooltip: When updating an existing table, this is the index of each existing data column which will be keps as the first index of the new column

parameters.title: Queried Time Buckets
parameters.name: queriedTimeBuckets
parameters.description: A List of Dictionaries respresenting the start and end timestamps of each time bucket queried. When creating a new Time Series Chart, this will include all time buckets for the chart's entire duration. When updating an existing chart, only the time buckets which are more recent than the newest bucket already in thc chart will be represented here.
parameters.tooltip: This should be the 'query_buckets' attribute of the output of the "Assemble Query Time Windows" operation

parameters.title: Query Results
parameters.name: queryResults
parameters.description: The results of the queries run for all data sets. This should be the output of the "Run Queries" Playbook step
parameters.tooltip: This should be a List of Dictionaries, each containing an attribute called "quantities"

parameters.title: Existing Data Columns
parameters.name: existingDataColumns
parameters.description: When appending data to an existing chart, this should be the data already present in the chart. Data which is now too old to be included in the chart will be removed, and new data will be  added to the end to represent more recent time buckets.
parameters.tooltip: When no such data is present, an empty List may be used instead
